alert.note: Alert for Jersey (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 22 at 1:18PM CST until February 22 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM CST FOR SOUTHEASTERN CALHOUN...SOUTHWESTERN GREENE...SOUTHWESTERN JERSEY...CENTRAL ST. CHARLES AND NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN COUNTIES... At 118 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Elsberry to near St. Paul to near Pacific, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... St. Charles, Hardin, Orchard Farms and Grafton. This also includes First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site and Pere Marquette State Park. This includes Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 216 and 229. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM CST for southwestern Illinois...and east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
